article.headline: Sacramento State 76, Montana 67
article.story: SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) -- Joel Jones scored 22 points and Jameel Pugh and Joseth Dawson added 11 apiece in Sacramento State's 76-67 victory over Montana on Saturday night. Jones, Dawson and Brandon Guyton hit two 3-pointers apiece as Sacramento State (9-11, 3-4 Big Sky) beat Montana for just the third time in 19 tries in school history. The Hornets also beat Montana State on Thursday for the Hornets' first sweep of the Montana schools since joining the Big Sky in 1996. Kamarr Davis scored 24 points for the Grizzlies (5-14, 2-5), who lost for the 13th time in 15 games and fell to 1-10 on the road. Kevin Criswell added 14 points for Montana. After trailing by 7 at the half, Montana opened the second half with a 17-9 run that gave the Grizzlies a 49-48 lead when Davis hit a layup with 10:45 to play. But Pugh answered with a 10-foot jump shot to put Sacramento State back in front, the beginning of a 28-18 run for the Hornets that finished the game. Sacramento State opened the game with a 10-2 run, and never relinquished the lead in the first half. The Hornets led 39-32 at halftime.
